title: Karthus would've been a better fit for the "Dark Star" theme than Thresh
body:
{{champion:30}} Has not had a skin for 2 years, with his latest being Fnatic Karthus.

Don't get me wrong, I think {{champion:412}} is a good fit too but he already has a lineup of great skins that at least change his particles. 

{{champion:30}} could've had 

* His Q be a nebula of stars or mini black holes
* His W be a huge nebula or black hole or wormhole kind of thing
* His E be a literal spinning galaxy or a black hole sucking things in
* His R be a huge supernova explode on top of enemies or just dark matter explode 

Like I said, the design team did a beautiful job with the skin but I personally think {{champion:30}} could've at least gotten some love and new particles.

Hiya! 

Wanted to drop by and give a bit of context into the discussions that we had when crafting the Dark Star thematic and why we selected Thresh and Varus. 

We wanted to create a legendary skin for Thresh, but wanted to create a fantasy that was a bit more dark and mature than what already existed. Thresh, of course, was a perfect fit for something more sinister; his base lore was already very dark and twisted. Dark Star amps up that evil by presenting a Thresh that has moved past devouring souls, this monster wants to devour your galaxy and reality itself.

We wanted to expand on the thematic, thus creating another champion for Thresh to share it with.  Varus fits well within the Dark Star alt-fantasy because it highlights his descent into darkness, but takes it that extra notch further. He’s not only corrupted, he’s completely consumed by the Dark Star’s twisted power.

That said, we aren't opposed to expanding this, or any other line that we've created before! I think Karthus would be a wonderful candidate for this particular thematic - he would fit in well with a darker theme, and as you've pointed out, the particles do have a lot of potential!

Why did you want to create a legendary skin for Thresh? Why did Thresh need this?

We felt there was a lot of potential, both with his personality, as well as his kit. There is a ton of particle work that we had the opportunity to utilize, and as for his personality, it meant new VO that could further who Thresh was with a more mature/darker thematic. 

Side note, (and unrelated to why we selected Thresh for a legendary skin), his last skin was in May of 2015, and it was legacy, and prior to that, he received Blood Moon, which was in January of 2015. He also has Championship Thresh, which is also legacy, meaning that only Deep Terror and Blood Moon are the only two skins available for him consistently.
I hate to be the guy who brings this up, but there are other champions whose last skin is farther back than Thresh... {{item:3070}} {{champion:6}} {{item:3070}} ;~;
Urgot is waiting on his VGU before he gets another skin, I believe.

As ViashinoWizard  and DarkRitual  have stated, Urgot currently is not eligible due to a pending rework/update. Unfortunately, anyone on the Champion Update list is not eligible for a skin until their update has been completed.
So that means that Morde won't be getting a skin any time soon?
If he's not on the update list, then he is eligible. ;)

I'd like to point out that Thresh got two skins within five months.

Meanwhile, there's champs that have been waiting for skins for five years.

Correct, however, we do not count esports skins towards 'getting a skin', since there isn't a ton of control as to which champions will get them - for Faker, it was pretty obvious Zed was going to be selected, but that didn't put him out of the running for another skin. 

 So, technically, Thresh's last skin was January of 2015, which is a fair amount of time between receiving Dark Star Thresh.
And Swain just hit the 4 year mark since getting a skin. May of 2015 is nothing compared to May of 2012. All while always been officially eligible for a skin according to you and other Rioters.

You're correct - unfortunately, his rig and model are incredibly outdated, which would put some serious limitations on skins we could give him, unless we're talking legendary status. That's not to say a legendary skin couldn't happen. However, it just means lower scope skins wouldn't be as great because of the limited movement options - See Blood Moon Zilean and the limitations on his sleeves, due to an older rig.

That's the first I've heard that about Swain and I follow this stuff - especially about champs I like such as Swain - very closely.

It would be good if you all advertised which champions have such skin limitations a lot better. We hear about Rumble/Eve having model limitations plenty but not much else.

That all aside, what Swain players are expecting is a legendary skin given that Dragon Master Swain has been promised by Rioters for all these years now. "Not a question of if but of when". Not that promises mean much anymore.

> It would be good if you all advertised which champions have such skin limitations a lot better. We hear about Rumble/Eve having model limitations plenty but not much else.

It's a discussion we could certainly have. I'm sure you've heard about Zac and his limitations due to the stretching when he moves around. I'm sure there are others, but that's the one that popped into my head 'cause it was a headache brainstorming ideas for the poor dude. At least Pool Party came out pretty solid.

Any older champion who hasn't had an update has rig limitations in terms of how we can make the character move. Sure, we can give them a new model, but if it's on an existing rig (which is what we do for lower tier skins), we may not be able to do x, y, and z. We can make minor adjustments if the new model calls for it (different hair, for example), but it's not a completely new rig. 

> That all aside, what Swain players are expecting is a legendary skin given that Dragon Master Swain has been promised by Rioters for all these years now. "Not a question of if but of when". Not that promises mean much anymore.

I understand that, and personally, I'm 100% on board with the idea. It's not something I have a ton of information about to share.  It's also not something I make the call on. ;_;

And I get that champs like Zyra and likely Yorick when he comes out are difficult because of the additional work required for plants/ghouls/Azir soldiers/what have you. 

It's not a great answer since players shouldn't really have to feel at a disadvantage in the skins department just because their champ is requires more work to get a basic level skin, but it is understandable.

While yes, some are harder to create than others, it doesn't hinder a champion from getting a new skin. It relies more heavily on ensuring the champion fits a thematic - the more they have to their kit, the more discussion we need to have to ensure everything fits together. For example, Haunted Zyra had to have a cohesive theme with all of her models. 

I don't want players to feel that way, and it's not how we approach the decision for new skins. I think better phrasing for that would be that they're more difficult, but not impossible by any means. They're also not at the bottom of the list, they do have the same chance as any other eligible champion to receive a skin. 

It's more of a disclaimer that these champions are simply more difficult to work with and require a bit more thought and effort in terms of development. With champions who are harder to work with, there could be concepts that just didn't work out, which means artists need to go back to the drawing board and find something else that works. We have had instances (not often, but it's happened) where we've worked on a skin, and it just didn't work out or meet the goals of the skin.

Thank you for the answer :)
Unfortunately, while you say "difficult champs" aren't less likely to get new skins, most of them have only a very limited number of skins and/or haven't got a skin in a long time. Zyra has already been mentioned, but Rumble is another one that comes to my mind. I must say though that I'm glad Kha'Zix got a skin recently, while (IIRC) being one of the "difficult champs" (due to the evolutions).

Anyway, we can just wait and hope ^^
Lower scope skins aren't the topic though. Legendary ones are.
